noun.description: Loss of reputation or respect as the result of a dishonorable action.
examples: he left the army in disgrace
if he'd gone back it would have brought disgrace on the family

verb.description: Bring shame or discredit on (someone or something)
examples: you have disgraced the family name
John stiffened his jaw so he wouldn't disgrace himself by crying

origin: Mid 16th century (as a verb): via French from Italian disgrazia (noun), disgraziare (verb), from dis- (expressing reversal) + Latin gratia grace.
